## How does the portal bridge this gap? 

::: {.incremental}

* The portal is a freely available **<span style="color:#1696d2;">one-stop-shop</span>** for all major datasets released by government agencies on U.S. schools, school districts, and colleges. 
* The portal includes harmonized data and metadata for **<span style="color:#1696d2;">100+ datasets</span>** published by 10+ agencies and institutions. 
* The portal makes it easier for both technical and non-technical users to look at **<span style="color:#1696d2;">trends over time</span>** and combine data **<span style="color:#1696d2;">from different sources</span>**. 

:::

## Using the portal **<span style="color:#1696d2;">R package</span>**...

**Example**: How has tuition at my alma mater changed?

. . . 

::: columns

::: {.column width="55%"}

```{.r code-line-numbers="4"}
library(educationdata)

# Get data 
carleton_data <- get_education_data(
  level = "college-university",
  source = "ipeds",
  topic = "academic-year-tuition",
  filters = list(
    year = c(1990:2020), 
    unitid = "173258", 
    tuition_type = "4"
  )
)

# Plot data 
carleton_data %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = year, y = tuition_fees_ft)) +
  geom_line()
```

:::

![](images/carleton-tuition-plot-r.png){.absolute top=200 left=580 width="500"}

## Using the portal **<span style="color:#1696d2;">Python package</span>**...

**Example**: How has tuition at my alma mater changed?

::: columns

::: {.column width="55%"}

```{.python code-line-numbers="4"}
import educationdata 

# Get data 
carleton_data = get_education_data(
  level = "college-university",
  source = "ipeds",
  topic = "academic-year-tuition",
  filters = {
    "year": range(1990, 2020), 
    "unitid": "173258", 
    "tuition_type": "4" 
  }
)

# Plot data 
carleton_data.plot.line(
  x = "year", y = "tuition_fees_ft"
)
```

## Using the **<span style="color:#1696d2;">summary endpoints</span>**...

**Example**: Have public institutions seen the same trend?

. . . 

::: {style="font-size: 60%"}

::: {.panel-tabset}

### R

::: columns

::: {.column width="55%"}

```{.r code-line-numbers="2,6-8"}
# Get summary data 
sector_avg_data <- get_education_data_summary(
  level = "college-university",
  source = "ipeds",
  topic = "academic-year-tuition",
  stat = "avg",
  var = "tuition_fees_ft",
  by = "sector",
  filters = list(
    level_of_study = "1", 
    tuition_type = "4", 
    sector = "1,2"
  )
)

# Plot data 
sector_avg_data %>%
  mutate(sector = factor(sector) %>%
    fct_recode("public" = "1", "private" = "2")) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = year, y = tuition_fees_ft, group = sector, color = sector)) +
  geom_line()
```
